bow: eli5 convertible car seats really having trouble here hello have 6mo son who is very close to becoming too tall for his infant car seat he is 19lbs ve been looking into getting new car seat for him but am quickly getting overwhelmed by all the jargon being used was hoping to get little help have modest budget but am willing to spend little more for quality and convenience hoping for less than 150 but willing to go up to 200 if that the only option would like to buy just one and have that seat last until he does need one anymore if possible we switch cars lot so was hoping that this new seat can switch easily does such car seat exist what should look for in my research thanks for your help edit thank you all for your help and links do know exactly which one going to get but feel much more confident that will get good one target that where we got both of our eddie bauer brand toddler carseats do remember exactly how much they were but we re flat broke so they could have been very much do bother buying one with booster seat as those are 15 20 on their own but the combo seats will charge you 50+ for that option as for switching easily none of them are easy but the ones we have are difficult by any means you can use the car seatbelt or the latch hooks thanks unfortunately there is target in my town ll be near target in couple weeks though this is what we have http www target com eddie bauer deluxe high back booster seat glencoe 13457488 prodslot=medium 21 amp term=eddie 20bauer she started using it around or months think she always been really tall the main thing is just looking at the weight ratings you want something that can stay rear facing as long as possible balanced with things like does it fit in my car we got recaro which is great and should last good long while for us but the does it fit in my car was something probably should have paid more attention to it works but it hard to get him in and out easily because it pretty big so just go to babies us or target when you can take some measurements and then balance the price with the weight ratings everything on the market is extensively tested and probably one seat is not much safer than another so lot is personal preference for design one consider is the graco size4me 70 or mysize70 http carseatblog com 18372 graco size4me 70 convertible carseat review it sounds very easy to get in and out at least until kiddo hits 48 pounds when you switch to using seat belts from latch slightly over your price range but given the size range and design should last you very very long time and carseatblog is giving one away might as well enter have the alpha omega car seat safety 1st think and really like it if you do want to have to buy another seat make sure to get one that has the hooks for the regular car seatbelt to go through when they reach booster seat age at that point you stop using the harness clips you can even take them out and use the car seat belt and your convertible car seat becomes high back booster most stores sell this type of seat you want to find something that allows rear facing forward facing and then booster seat capabilities it more important to look at the height requirements than the weight ones most children outgrow them vertically long before they hit the weight limits if your kiddo is already outgrowing his seat at months you definitely want the best height you can get they can get very expensive but the safety 1st alpha omega http www target com safety 1st convertible car seat titanium alpha 10749426 prodslot=medium 11 might be an option unfortunately convertible seats do not switch easily like the infant ones which pop in an out of secured bases they have to be fully installed each time you move them it not super long process but it opens up the chance for improper installation and real safety concerns to do it often it much safer to have one in each vehicle not sure you re going to be able to *completely* get away with not buying another as 6mo old has different needs than year old but you ll want to look for one with the largest poundage usually the number in the name if possible you should seat child rear facing as long as possible preferably up to realize that most people do do that but in my opinion 6mo is little early to switch to forward just my opinion was originally looking in the 150 range also but ended splurging up to 200 ordered britax marathon 70 it rear faces to 45 pounds and is usable front facing to 70 those were the highest numbers read longest usage found love this car seat consider if very easy to move between vehicles and it is the only one we have we switch between mine my husbands and my mother cars its latches are like seat belts as in they have button to release but they still use the hooks in the frame of the seat also would like to point out used this rear facing in honda civic not many seats can accommodate that here is link to amazon at 211 though bought mine for 198 about year ago do remember from what site http www amazon com britax marathon 70 g3 convertible seat dp b00834d5so ref=sr s=baby products amp ie=utf8 amp qid=1357752801 amp sr=1 got this for both my kids both rear and forward facing and positively love it for the cost tried to get something cheaper and it was awful easy to switch from car to car with just running the seatbelt option it is bit big but it so great and my kids love it added bonus is the easy strap adjustment to it bulky jacket push down the red switch and loosen up the straps light sweater the next day just turn the knob and tightens up easily recommend it to everyone who asks http www toysrus com product index jsp productid=4133855 if you are adjusting the harness for jacket it is too bulky to be worn safely under the harness you should not have to adjust the harness at all due to outerwear in collision bulky jacket will compress and result in slack in the harness often an inch or more which can result in serious injury or your child being ejected from the seat warm thin layers like polar fleece are ideal this http www toysrus com product index jsp productid=11563636 amp searchurl=false is what have for my almost 2yr old goes up to 40lbs rf he 27lbs and then can be turned and used up to 65lbs ff it sits in my husband mazda3 and put it into mine as well and it fits great it super light easy to transfer from one car to another and it runs about 85 100 at babies us have this one http www toysrus com product index jsp productid=12894134 in my car for him right now and ready to get another of the safety 1st ones for my car we have this carseat and love it also love that there is knob on the side to easily tighten the straps it so easy to get the kids in and out of you can also order very similar one from target with free shipping you re best bet is to look for rear facing forward facing seat that has high rf ff weight limits each step up in car seats is step down in safety rf ff booster seatbelt by the time your child needs booster after outgrowing one if those harnessed seats you ll likely be able to get cheap backless booster many of the in seats like the alpha onega and all its clones are not great at any one stage the ao pretty much do work well as booster for any child are hard to install in many vehicles the graco myride70 or size4me70 are great options if you re in the usa the graco smart seat has separate base which would make it much easier to switch between cars but it around 300 the scenera is decent seat for under 100 and once baby outgrows it rf you could get ff only harness to booster seat search car seat org for threads on your vehicles and which seats install best the important thing is to keep your kid rear facing as long as you can it the safest not only is months too early it actually illegal in most states to forward face until 12 months good to know ll put in yet another vote for the alpha omega my boys and are still in them we ve had them years and they prefer them to their booster seats in our other car because they re more comfy prefer them because they re latched in easy to move my kids can sleep in them because of the head support and they offer much more protection they also do take up as much room or cost nearly as much as the britax marathons great seats if you drive big surburban everything ve read says the weight and not height is what matters forget exactly how much we paid but way less than normal for it at costco here list of recommended car seats the forum that is linked at the top of this page is great too http carseatblog com carseatblogcoms recommended car seats you would need convertible car seat so you can keep your son rear facing for as long as possible years is the recommended **minimum** now then you turn the seat forward facing when he outgrows the rear facing limits and here is link for some good car seat usage info http www car safety org basics html see several people have recommended the alpha omega ll disagree with that it not very good seat in general in seats rear facing front facing then booster are usually not very good the evenflo symphony is the only exception and even that is only good option for short to average height kids because it can only be used rear facing when the head rest is in the lowest positions britax are nice seats but they are bit shorter compared to other seats this makes them nice for small cars and short average height kids though they are overpriced for what they offer in my opinion you can get less expensive seat that can be used rear facing for longer in my opinion the best choices for high weight and height limits are the diono radian safety 1st complete air 65 babies us now has complete air 70 which is basically the same graco size4me 70 aka known as the mysize 70 at babies us and the true fit this is tall seat but only has 35 lb rear facing weight limit so it is best for tall kids that are skinny or average weight the rest of these seats have 40 or 45 lb limits if you go to babies us store they will allow you to take display car seats out to your car so you can try installing them to make sure they fit and you like them before buying they do carry the diono radian and maybe not the true fit either but should have the rest mentioned also once you decide on seat shop around online for sale prices for example albeebaby com has the extremes the alpha omega and its clones do not work well as belt positioning boosters they are incredibly difficult to install in many vehicles cringe every time get one at an installation clinic the weight is usually the most important number to look at if seat rf to 40 45lbs your child is much less likely to outgrow the seat by height first if your child has an exceptionally long torso you definitely want to get seat with tall shell as well an infant bucket seat with 35lb limit will be outgrown by height before convertible seat with the same weight limit due to shell height also after northbay 10745678 something with sure latch is well work the extra money it makes installation and moving from car to car breeze love mine think ours was about 80 had an ao seat for years that survived nieces and nephews of various ages and stages so got the same one for my son when he outgrew his carrier while it is important to look for seat with high weight limit it is also useful to know the functional height limit seat is outgrown by height when rear facing when the top of the head is less than an inch from the top of the shell of the seat note it has nothing to do with their legs feet as is commonly thought the seat is outgrown by height when forward facing when the shoulders are higher than the top slots or sometimes when the ears are even with the top of the shell not all seats with the same weight limit will accommodate to the same height recommend car seat org for all carseat questions those people know everything there is to know about this good to know have tried one myself the diono radian may work from birth to seatbelt but you certainly are going to find in for under 150 that does all those things well or if will expire before you ve reached the 3rd
